numbered_ace_sentences: 1. This graph is based on opinions of people.
2. Some inferences can be made about the trend in the graph.
3. Some countries are near the top right corner of the graph.
4. In these countries, more adults agree that the world is getting better with each generation.
5. In these countries, more young adults agree that the world is getting better with each generation.
6. Most of these countries are third-world countries or developing countries.
7. I infer that people in developing countries are more satisfied with newer generations.
8. I infer that people in third-world countries are more satisfied with newer generations.
9. Developing countries grow faster than developed countries.
10. Third-world countries grow faster than developed countries.
11. A developing country starts at a lower point than a developed country.
12. A third-world country starts at a lower point than a developed country.
13. If development is faster then people are more satisfied with newer generations.
14. I wonder what other factors about the countries impact the data distribution.
15. I am in the age range from 15 years to 24 years.
16. I believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
17. Most data points are above the solid black line.
18. The data supports my claim.
19. If a data point is above the solid black line then more young adults agree than adults who are 40 years old or older.
20. This indicates that more people in my age range agree with me than people in the 40+ age range.
21. This data relates to my community.
22. I asked some people in my age range in my community.
23. Many of these people agree with me.
24. The graph compares opinions of adults and opinions of young adults.
25. The opinions are about the new generation and the old generations.
26. The heading is: What does the present think about the future?
